doc:
Frank Tinney https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Tinney 0 Frank Aloysius Robert Tinney (March 29, 1878 – November 28, 1940) was an American blackface comedian and actor. Tinney achieved considerable success in vaudeville and on Broadway in the early 20th century. Comedian Joe Cook considered Tinney "the greatest natural comic ever developed in America." Tinney's career and marriage were ruined after he was accused of beating his mistress, Ziegfeld girl Imogene "Bubbles" Wilson in May 1924. Although he was never formally charged, the ensuing publicity ruined his reputation. Tinney suffered a number of health problems after the scandal and eventually had a nervous breakdown. He never regained his health and died in November 1940. Frank_Aloysius_Robert_Tinney ( March_29_,_1878 – November_28_,_1940 ) was an_American_blackface_comedian_and_actor . Tinney achieved considerable_success in vaudeville and on Broadway in the_early_20th_century . Comedian_Joe_Cook considered Tinney " the_greatest_natural_comic ever developed in America . " Tinney 's_career_and_marriage were_ruined after he was_accused of beating his_mistress , Ziegfeld_girl_Imogene_"_Bubbles_"_Wilson in May_1924 . Although he was_never_formally_charged , the_ensuing_publicity ruined his_reputation . Tinney suffered a_number of health_problems after the_scandal and eventually_had a_nervous_breakdown . He never regained his_health and died in November_1940 .
